boardgame.name: Trick of the Rails
トリック・オブ・ザ・レイルズ
boardgame.description: Trick of the Rails, themed on the rise of the American railway period, combines 18XX-like portfolio management and a trick-taking card game. Players collect stock certificates and make the companies more valuable by laying the rail network._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game alternates between stock rounds and operating rounds. In stock rounds, the cards played become shares for the players. In operating rounds, the cards played become track for the companies. The companies get trains, which determine how many track cards they can count for their profit (the trains have costs as well, which may lead to companies not making any profit at all) and in the end, players simply count the value of their shares and highest value wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

The game has only been played twice, but I am listing the condition as only _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;acceptable_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; because the box is really flimsy and already looks kinda beat up. If you have played an Audlung-Spiele box, well, it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s flimsier, and possibly a little smaller, than that. The cards are of somewhat thin stock, too, but have been treated carefully and are in good condition. This is a perfectly playable copy, and it comes with English and Japanese rules. I will only shop this in the small Priority Mail flat-rate box (or of course will combine with another purchase).
